body_html:
Thanks to a lot of help from @guschmue we were able to debug this to use of __forceinline in eigen.
Unfortunately, removing __forceinline brings performance hits in the built binary, which is unacceptable for TF. Therefore, in our presubmits we remove forceinline, and our releases we do use forceinline.

Since this is a VS-eigen issue that unfortunately hits TF in a bad way, I will close this issue.
There is not much else we can do given all the information.
body_text:
Thanks to a lot of help from @guschmue we were able to debug this to use of __forceinline in eigen.
Unfortunately, removing __forceinline brings performance hits in the built binary, which is unacceptable for TF. Therefore, in our presubmits we remove forceinline, and our releases we do use forceinline.
Since this is a VS-eigen issue that unfortunately hits TF in a bad way, I will close this issue.
There is not much else we can do given all the information.
body:
Thanks to a lot of help from @guschmue we were able to debug this to use of `__forceinline` in eigen.
Unfortunately, removing `__forceinline` brings performance hits in the built binary, which is unacceptable for TF. Therefore, in our presubmits we remove forceinline, and our releases we do use forceinline.

Since this is a VS-eigen issue that unfortunately hits TF in a bad way, I will close this issue.
There is not much else we can do given all the information.
